intro: Asyneuma lobelioides f. stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf asyneuma, is a variant of the asyneuma plant characterized by its slender, elongated leaves. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes numerous species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands or stream banks. Its flowers are small and tubular, often displaying a range of colors from white to purple. This form is notable for its distinct leaf morphology, which sets it apart from other variants of the species.
